PerlMonks has, for the most part, been a place without a lot of hard-and-fast rules. Unfortunately, some abuses of the voting/experience system have resulted in the need for some rules regarding user accounts.

  1. A person may have only one account which they use for voting.

  2. Any person creating multiple accounts must identify and report these to the [gods] ([/msg] [gods]) and identify the one account which is to be used for voting. The other accounts will be barred from voting.

  3. A person will not be able to use their voting account to vote on nodes belonging to any of their other accounts.

  4. Creating a new account in order to circumvent [id://539865]ing or other restrictions will not be tolerated.

Rest assured that any attempts to hide multiple accounts from the [gods] will fail. Have a nice day. :-)
